alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:52AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jackson, Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Lee, Des Moines, Hancock and Henderson Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water reaches the base of the flood wall at the Ice Harbor. Most of the houses on the river side of the East Dubuque levee are in water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Tuesday morning and continue rising to 19.7 feet Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
